text: James David Campbell Walker (born 25 August 1968) is a British rower. He competed at the 1992 Summer Olympics and the 1996 Summer Olympics. He was also a trialist for the British team for the 2000 Summer Olympics.Will Buckley, "Missing the Boat to Sydney" The Observer, 10 September 2000 During his rowing career he competed for clubs including King's School, Chester,King's School Herald newsletter "Elite Olympians past and present (page 8)" 2012 University of London Boat Club,University of London Boat Club web site "UL Grand Winners and Olympians to row over at HRR" 29 June 2017 and Molesey Boat Club. He went on to co-found The Climate Group in 2004.Sir Richard Branson, "Low Carbon Innovation and Leadership" Virgin Group website, April 2014 ==References== ==External links== Category:1968 births Category:Living people Category:British male rowers Category:Olympic rowers of Great Britain Category:Rowers at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Rowers at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Chester
title: Jim Walker (rower)
